abstract: United States government has put classified designation on information about how American money is being spent to build and train Afghanistan's army and police forces; American military command claims data, which was made public in past, needs to be kept secret in order to protect American and Afghan soldiers and citizens; classification of information removes vital means of assessing success of American mission in Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: Details on the money that the United States has spent to build Afghanistan’s security forces were once shared, but the information is now considered classified.
snippet: Details on the money that the United States has spent to build Afghanistan’s security forces were once shared, but the information is now considered classified.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: U.S. Suddenly Goes Quiet on Effort to Bolster Afghan Forces
headline.print_headline: U.S. Suddenly Goes Quiet on Effort to Bolster Afghan Forces
